name: Philip SPRAGUE and Marilyn Sprague, Appellants, v. Thomas E. CREAMER, M.D., and Wyeth Laboratories, Inc., and the Medical Professional Catastrophe Loss Fund

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
McDERMOTT, J., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
parties: Philip SPRAGUE and Marilyn Sprague, Appellants, v. Thomas E. CREAMER, M.D., and Wyeth Laboratories, Inc., and the Medical Professional Catastrophe Loss Fund.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Order affirmed.
McDERMOTT, J., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Thomas B. Rutter, Philadelphia, for appellants.
Joseph S. Sabadish, Deputy Atty. Gen., for appellees.
Adrian R. King, for Creamer, M.D.
Murray S. Levin, Philadelphia, for Wyeth Laboratories.
casebody.head_matter:
565 A.2d 157
Philip SPRAGUE and Marilyn Sprague, Appellants, v. Thomas E. CREAMER, M.D., and Wyeth Laboratories, Inc., and the Medical Professional Catastrophe Loss Fund.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Oct. 23, 1989.
Decided Nov. 1, 1989.
Thomas B. Rutter, Philadelphia, for appellants.
Joseph S. Sabadish, Deputy Atty. Gen., for appellees.
Adrian R. King, for Creamer, M.D.
Murray S. Levin, Philadelphia, for Wyeth Laboratories.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
